record_data.record_plain_text:
Kimberly-Clark Corporation Market-Based Rate Authority Tariff
Version 0.1.0
Availability: Kimberly-Clark Corporation ("K-C") makes electric energy and capacity available under this tariff to any purchaser, except as prohibited below. K-C also makes available to any purchaser ancillary services, except as prohibited below:
PJM: K-C offers regulation and frequency response service for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ("PJM") and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection.
New England: K-C offers operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by ISO New England, Inc.
Third-Party Provider: Third-party ancillary services: Regulation Service. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third party provider, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of a public utility affiliated with the third party provider; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirement to offer ancillary services to its own customers.
Applicability: This tariff is applicable to all sales of electric energy, capacity and ancillary services by K-C at market-based rates.
Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and K-C.
Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between K-C and the purchaser.
Compliance with Commission Regulations: K-C shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions that the Commission imposes in its orders concerning K-C's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes K-C to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits K-C's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any other orders of the Commission concerning K-C's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff.
Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: K-C does not have any limitation on its market-based rate authority, except as otherwise provided in this tariff. K-C has obtained waivers from Subparts B and C of Part 35, regarding the filing of tariffs, except sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16; Part 41, regarding accounts, records, and memoranda; Part 101, regarding the uniform system of accounts; and Part 141, regarding statements and reports. K-C also has blanket approval under Part 34 of the Commission's regulations regarding future issuances of securities and assumptions of liabilities, subject to objection by an interested party. See Kimberly-Clark Corporation, Docket No. ER08-495-000 (unpublished Letter Order) (_____________, 2008).
Effective Date: This tariff is effective April 1, 2008.
